discussion.content: B is correct - policy id:5::port3->port1, LOCAL_WINDOWS, Facebook,443

comments.content: B is correct Facebook.web is a internet service

discussion.content: A is correct because ISDB name is Facebook-web and not Facebook.web
A is correct - Because in B the destination is Facebook.web and not Facebook.com

comments.content: A. The policy with ID 1 (ID 1 matches ALL services). Where does it say it only match UDP service? I am also in doubt because like amihai said, on B says that the destination is Facebook.web and not Facebook.com
The policy with ID 5 doesn't contain a service port.

Nevermind, just realized now that facebook.web is a Internet Service Object, what include facebook.com...

B is correct.
A only match udp service and not tcp 443.

discussion.content: The source was also translated to 10.0.1.10

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

The exhibit shows the output from a debug flow.
Which two statements about the output are correct? (Choose two.)

choices.B: The source IP address of the packet was translated to 10.0.1.10.
choices.A: The packet was allowed by the firewall policy with the ID 00007fc0.
choices.C: FortiGate received a TCP SYN/ACK packet.
choices.D: FortiGate routed the packet through port3.

questions.question_text: What is required to create an inter-VDOM link between two VDOMs?

comments.content:
Note that similar to using inter-VLAN routing, Layer 3 must be involvedâ€“you cannot create an inter-VDOM link between Layer 2 transparent mode VDOMs. At least one of the VDOMs must be operating in NAT mode.
This, among other benefits, prevents potential Layer 2 loops.
According to which part on that page?

discussion.content: Correct answer is A according to FortiGate_Infrastructure_6.2_Study_Guide p.134

choices.C: The inspection mode of at least one VDOM must be NGFW policy-based.
choices.D: The inspection mode of both VDOMs must match.
choices.B: Both VDOMs must operate in NAT mode.
choices.A: At least one of the VDOMs must operate in NAT mode.

questions.question_text: What FortiGate configuration is required to actively prompt users for credentials?

choices.A: You must enable one or more protocols that support active authentication on a firewall policy.
choices.D: You must enable the Authentication setting on the firewall policy
choices.B: You must position the firewall policy for active authentication before a firewall policy for passive authentication
choices.C: You must assign users to a group for active authentication

discussion.content:
C & D are correct;
A is not correct because dynamic routing is not possible between the Transparent and NAT VDOMs

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

The exhibit shows network configurations. VDOM1 is operating in transparent mode. VDOM2 is operating in NAT mode. There is an inter-VDOM link between both VDOMs. A client workstation with the IP address 10.0.1.10/24 is connected to port2. A web server with the IP address 10.200.1.2/24 is connected to port1.
Which two options must be included in the FortiGate configuration to route and allow connections from the client workstation to the web server? (Choose two.)

choices.C: One firewall policy in VDOM1 with port2 as the source interface and InterVDOM0 as the destination interface.
choices.A: A static or dynamic route in VDOM2 with the subnet 10.0.1.0/24 as the destination.
choices.D: One firewall policy in VDOM2 with InterVDOM1 as the source interface and port1 as the destination interface.
choices.B: A static or dynamic route in VDOM1 with the subnet 10.200.1.0/24 as the destination.
